app.title: BenefitFinder
app.subtitle: Find Your Government Benefits
app.description: A privacy-preserving tool to help you discover government benefits you may be eligible for.

questionnaire.title: Eligibility Questionnaire
questionnaire.subtitle: Answer questions to find out which benefits you may qualify for
questionnaire.question: Question

validation.maxLength: Must be no more than {{max}} characters
validation.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address
validation.invalidPhone: Please enter a valid phone number

results.title: Eligibility Results
results.subtitle: Based on your answers, here are the benefits you may be eligible for
results.noResultsMessage: No benefits found matching your criteria
results.tryAgain: Try adjusting your answers or check back later

specificReasons.title: Why you don't qualify:
specificReasons.generic: You may not meet the specific eligibility requirements for this program

maybeReasons.title: What you need to address:
maybeReasons.generic: You may need to provide additional information or meet certain requirements

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for WIC! You can receive nutritional benefits and support.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for WIC. Contact your local WIC office to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for WIC. Contact your local WIC office to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for WIC, but eligibility can change. Contact your local WIC office to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for WIC. Contact your local WIC office to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What WIC provides:
benefits.foods: Milk, cheese, eggs, cereal, juice, fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes
benefits.childFood: Monthly food package worth approximately $35-55 per child
benefits.generalFood: Monthly food package with healthy foods
benefits.referrals: Referrals to other health and social services

requirements.title: WIC requirements:
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
requirements.residence: Must live in the state where you apply
requirements.nutritionalRisk: Must have nutritional risk (assessed by WIC staff)
requirements.pregnant: Must be pregnant (any stage of pregnancy)
requirements.children: Must have children under 5 years old
requirements.category: Must be pregnant, postpartum (up to 6 months), breastfeeding (up to 1 year), or have children under 5
requirements.income: Must meet income guidelines (185% of federal poverty level)

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact your local WIC office to apply
nextSteps.schedule: Schedule an appointment for nutritional assessment
nextSteps.documents: Bring required documents to your appointment
nextSteps.childGuidance: Ask about child nutrition and feeding guidance
nextSteps.discuss: Contact your local WIC office to discuss your situation
nextSteps.checkBack: Check back if your situation changes
nextSteps.reapply: Consider reapplying if your situation changes

additionalSteps.prenatalCare: Ask about prenatal care coverage and services
additionalSteps.childrenHealth: Ask about children's health coverage and services
additionalSteps.prenatalNutrition: Ask about nutrition education for pregnant women
additionalSteps.familyNutrition: Ask about nutrition education for families with children
additionalSteps.alternativeHealth: Ask about alternative health coverage options
additionalSteps.alternativeFood: Ask about alternative food assistance programs
additionalSteps.otherHealth: Ask about other health coverage programs
additionalSteps.otherFood: Ask about other food assistance programs

specificReasons.title: Why you don't qualify:
specificReasons.notPregnant: You indicated you are not pregnant
specificReasons.noChildren: You indicated you don't have children under 5 years old
specificReasons.incomeTooHigh: Your household income may be above the WIC income guidelines (185% of federal poverty level)
specificReasons.notCitizen: You indicated you are not a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
specificReasons.noNutritionalRisk: You may not have a nutritional risk that WIC addresses
specificReasons.ageRestriction: You may not meet the age requirements for WIC eligibility

howToApply.title: How to apply for WIC:
howToApply.findOffice: Find your local WIC office by calling 1-800-221-5689 or visiting fns.usda.gov/wic
howToApply.schedule: Schedule an appointment for nutritional assessment
howToApply.bringDocuments: Bring required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of pregnancy/children)
howToApply.assessment: Complete nutritional assessment with WIC staff

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.education: WIC provides nutrition education and breastfeeding support
resources.locations: WIC benefits are provided through local health departments and clinics

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for Medicaid! You can receive comprehensive health coverage.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for Medicaid. Contact your state Medicaid office to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for Medicaid. Contact your state Medicaid office to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for Medicaid, but eligibility can change. Contact your state Medicaid office to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for Medicaid. Contact your state Medicaid office to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What Medicaid provides:
benefits.mentalHealth: Mental health and substance abuse treatment
benefits.dentalVision: Dental and vision care (varies by state)

requirements.title: Medicaid requirements:
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
requirements.residence: Must live in the state where you apply
requirements.income: Must meet income guidelines (varies by state and category)
requirements.age: Age requirements vary by state and program

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact your state Medicaid office to apply
nextSteps.online: Apply online through your state's Medicaid website
nextSteps.documents: Gather required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of citizenship)
nextSteps.verification: Provide verification of income and other requirements
nextSteps.enrollment: Choose a health plan and enroll in coverage

additionalSteps.prenatalCare: Ask about prenatal care coverage and services
additionalSteps.childrenHealth: Ask about children's health coverage and services
additionalSteps.alternativeHealth: Ask about alternative health coverage options
additionalSteps.otherHealth: Ask about other health coverage programs

howToApply.title: How to apply for Medicaid:
howToApply.findOffice: Find your state Medicaid office or apply online
howToApply.gatherDocuments: Gather required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of citizenship)
howToApply.verification: Provide verification of income and other requirements
howToApply.enrollment: Choose a health plan and enroll in coverage

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.coverage: Coverage varies by state but includes essential health benefits

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for Medi-Cal! California's Medicaid program provides comprehensive health coverage.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for Medi-Cal. Contact your local county office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What Medi-Cal provides:
benefits.dentalVision: Dental and vision care (included in California)
benefits.mentalHealth: Mental health and substance abuse treatment (expanded in California)
benefits.transportation: Transportation to medical appointments (available in California)

resources.stateOffice: Contact your local county social services office
resources.coverage: Medi-Cal includes all essential health benefits plus additional California-specific services

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for Texas Medicaid! You can receive health coverage through the state program.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for Texas Medicaid. Contact your local HHSC office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What Texas Medicaid provides:
benefits.dentalVision: Limited dental and vision care (varies by program)

resources.coverage: Texas Medicaid coverage varies by program and may be more limited than other states

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for SNAP! You can receive monthly food assistance.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for SNAP. Contact your local SNAP office to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for SNAP. Contact your local SNAP office to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for SNAP, but eligibility can change. Contact your local SNAP office to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for SNAP. Contact your local SNAP office to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What SNAP provides:
benefits.ebtCard: Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card for food purchases
benefits.foodItems: Can be used to buy most food items at participating stores
benefits.farmerMarkets: Can be used at many farmers markets
benefits.onlineShopping: Can be used for online grocery shopping (in some areas)

requirements.title: SNAP requirements:
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
requirements.residence: Must live in the state where you apply
requirements.income: Must meet income guidelines (130% of federal poverty level)
requirements.assets: Must meet asset limits (varies by household type)
requirements.work: Must meet work requirements (for able-bodied adults without dependents)
requirements.socialSecurity: Must provide Social Security numbers for all household members

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact your local SNAP office to apply
nextSteps.online: Apply online through your state's SNAP website
nextSteps.documents: Gather required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of expenses)
nextSteps.verification: Provide verification of income and expenses
nextSteps.ebtCard: Receive EBT card and start using benefits

additionalSteps.prenatalNutrition: Ask about nutrition education for pregnant women
additionalSteps.familyNutrition: Ask about nutrition education for families with children
additionalSteps.alternativeFood: Ask about alternative food assistance programs
additionalSteps.otherFood: Ask about other food assistance programs

howToApply.title: How to apply for SNAP:
howToApply.findOffice: Find your local SNAP office or apply online
howToApply.gatherDocuments: Gather required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of expenses)
howToApply.verification: Provide verification of income and expenses
howToApply.ebtCard: Receive EBT card and start using benefits

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.nutrition: SNAP provides nutrition assistance to low-income individuals and families
resources.ebt: Benefits are provided through Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) cards

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for CalFresh! California's SNAP program provides monthly food assistance.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for CalFresh. Contact your local county office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What CalFresh provides:
benefits.ebtCard: Golden State Advantage EBT card for food purchases
benefits.farmerMarkets: Can be used at farmers markets (many accept CalFresh)
benefits.onlineShopping: Can be used for online grocery shopping (expanded in California)

resources.stateOffice: Contact your local county social services office
resources.nutrition: CalFresh provides nutrition assistance with additional California-specific programs

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for SNAP! You can receive monthly food assistance through the Texas program.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for SNAP. Contact your local HHSC office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What Texas SNAP provides:
benefits.ebtCard: Lone Star Card (EBT) for food purchases
benefits.farmerMarkets: Can be used at participating farmers markets

resources.nutrition: Texas SNAP provides nutrition assistance with state-specific programs

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for SSI! You can receive monthly cash assistance and other benefits.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for SSI. Contact Social Security to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for SSI. Contact Social Security to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for SSI, but eligibility can change. Contact Social Security to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for SSI. Contact Social Security to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What SSI provides:
benefits.monthlyCash: Monthly cash assistance (up to $943 for individuals, $1,415 for couples in 2024)
benefits.medicaid: Automatic Medicaid eligibility in most states
benefits.snap: Automatic SNAP eligibility in most states
benefits.workIncentives: Work incentives and employment support programs

requirements.title: SSI requirements:
requirements.age: Must be 65 or older, OR blind, OR disabled
requirements.disability: Must have a qualifying disability (if under 65 and not blind)
requirements.income: Must have limited income (varies by state and living situation)
requirements.assets: Must have limited resources (under $2,000 for individuals, $3,000 for couples)
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
requirements.residence: Must live in the United States or Northern Mariana Islands

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact Social Security at 1-800-772-1213 or visit ssa.gov
nextSteps.gather: Gather required documents (birth certificate, medical records, financial statements)
nextSteps.apply: Apply online at ssa.gov or visit your local Social Security office
nextSteps.urgent: Apply as soon as possible - benefits are not retroactive
nextSteps.review: Review your situation with a Social Security representative

howToApply.title: How to apply for SSI:
howToApply.step1: Contact Social Security at 1-800-772-1213 or visit ssa.gov
howToApply.step2: Schedule an appointment at your local Social Security office
howToApply.step3: Gather required documents (birth certificate, medical records, financial statements)
howToApply.step4: Complete the SSI application with a Social Security representative

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.localOffice: Find your local Social Security office at ssa.gov/locator
resources.advocacy: Get help from disability advocacy organizations

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for TANF! You can receive temporary cash assistance and support services.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for TANF. Contact your local TANF office to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for TANF. Contact your local TANF office to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for TANF, but eligibility can change. Contact your local TANF office to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for TANF. Contact your local TANF office to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What TANF provides:
benefits.cashAssistance: Temporary cash assistance for families with children
benefits.familySupport: Family support services and case management
benefits.childcare: Childcare assistance for work or education
benefits.generalCash: Temporary cash assistance for eligible families
benefits.workSupport: Work support services and job training
benefits.services: Support services including transportation and job search assistance
benefits.workRequirements: Must participate in work activities (varies by state)

requirements.title: TANF requirements:
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant
requirements.residence: Must live in the state where you apply
requirements.income: Must meet income guidelines (varies by state and household size)
requirements.children: Must have children under 18 (or 19 if still in high school)
requirements.family: Must be part of a family with children
requirements.work: Must participate in work activities (varies by state)
requirements.timeLimit: Subject to lifetime time limits (typically 60 months)

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact your local TANF office to apply
nextSteps.schedule: Schedule an appointment for application and interview
nextSteps.documents: Gather required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of children)
nextSteps.familyServices: Ask about family support services and case management
nextSteps.workRequirements: Discuss work requirements and available job training
nextSteps.discuss: Contact your local TANF office to discuss your situation
nextSteps.checkBack: Check back if your situation changes
nextSteps.reapply: Consider reapplying if your situation changes

additionalSteps.familySupport: Ask about family support services and case management
additionalSteps.childcareAssistance: Ask about childcare assistance for work or education
additionalSteps.workTraining: Ask about job training and employment services
additionalSteps.alternativeAssistance: Ask about alternative cash assistance programs
additionalSteps.otherFamily: Ask about other family support programs

howToApply.title: How to apply for TANF:
howToApply.findOffice: Find your local TANF office or apply online
howToApply.schedule: Schedule an appointment for application and interview
howToApply.bringDocuments: Bring required documents (ID, proof of income, proof of children)
howToApply.interview: Complete application and participate in interview
howToApply.workPlan: Develop and agree to work plan and requirements
howToApply.receiveBenefits: Receive benefits and participate in required activities

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.hotline: TANF hotline: Contact your local office for assistance
resources.workServices: Work support services and job training programs

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for CalWORKs! California's TANF program provides temporary cash assistance.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for CalWORKs. Contact your local county office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What CalWORKs provides:
benefits.cashAssistance: Temporary cash assistance for families with children
benefits.familySupport: Family support services and case management
benefits.childcare: Childcare assistance for work or education
benefits.workSupport: Work support services and job training

resources.stateOffice: Contact your local county social services office
resources.workServices: CalWORKs provides comprehensive work support services

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for TANF! You can receive temporary cash assistance through the Texas program.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for TANF. Contact your local HHSC office to confirm and apply.

benefits.title: What Texas TANF provides:
benefits.cashAssistance: Temporary cash assistance for families with children
benefits.familySupport: Family support services and case management
benefits.childcare: Childcare assistance for work or education
benefits.workSupport: Work support services and job training

resources.workServices: Texas TANF provides work support services and job training

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for Section 8! You can receive rental assistance to help with housing costs.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for Section 8. Contact your local housing authority to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for Section 8. Contact your local housing authority to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for Section 8, but eligibility can change. Contact your local housing authority to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for Section 8. Contact your local housing authority to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What Section 8 provides:
benefits.rentalAssistance: Rental assistance to help pay for housing in the private market
benefits.housingChoice: Choice of housing anywhere in the United States (with portability)
benefits.portability: Ability to move and keep your voucher (portability)
benefits.fairMarketRent: Assistance based on local fair market rent rates
benefits.utilities: Some utility assistance may be available

requirements.title: Section 8 requirements:
requirements.income: Must have very low income (typically 50% of area median income or less)
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or eligible immigrant
requirements.housingNeed: Must demonstrate housing need (overcrowded, unsafe, or unaffordable housing)
requirements.cooperation: Must cooperate with housing authority requirements

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact your local housing authority immediately
nextSteps.waitlist: Get on the waiting list (can be very long - years)
nextSteps.documentation: Gather required documents (income verification, ID, etc.)
nextSteps.interview: Complete application and participate in interview
nextSteps.voucher: Receive voucher and find suitable housing

howToApply.title: How to apply for Section 8:
howToApply.step1: Contact your local housing authority to get on the waiting list
howToApply.step2: Complete the Section 8 application when your name comes up
howToApply.step3: Provide required documentation (income, family composition, etc.)
howToApply.step4: Participate in interview and housing inspection
howToApply.step5: Find suitable housing and receive voucher

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.localOffice: Find your local housing authority at hud.gov/program_offices/public_indian_housing/pha/contacts
resources.housingAuthority: Contact your local housing authority for application and waiting list information

statusMessages.qualified: You are eligible for LIHTC housing! You can access affordable housing options in your area.
statusMessages.likely: You appear to be eligible for LIHTC housing. Contact local housing providers to confirm and apply.
statusMessages.maybe: You may be eligible for LIHTC housing. Contact local housing providers to discuss your situation.
statusMessages.unlikely: You may not currently qualify for LIHTC housing, but eligibility can change. Contact local housing providers to discuss.
statusMessages.notQualified: You may not currently qualify for LIHTC housing. Contact local housing providers to discuss your situation and see if you qualify.

benefits.title: What LIHTC housing provides:
benefits.affordableHousing: Affordable housing units with reduced rent
benefits.reducedRent: Rent set at 30% of income or below
benefits.locationChoice: Choice of location within participating properties

requirements.title: LIHTC housing requirements:
requirements.income: Must meet income limits (typically 50-60% of area median income)
requirements.familySize: Must meet family size requirements for unit size
requirements.citizenship: Must be a U.S. citizen or eligible immigrant
requirements.rentalHistory: Must have good rental history and references
requirements.application: Must complete application and provide documentation

nextSteps.title: Next steps:
nextSteps.contact: Contact local LIHTC housing providers immediately
nextSteps.waitlist: Get on waiting lists for available units
nextSteps.documentation: Gather required documents (income verification, ID, etc.)
nextSteps.interview: Complete application and participate in interview
nextSteps.lease: Sign lease and move into affordable housing unit

howToApply.title: How to apply for LIHTC housing:
howToApply.step1: Find LIHTC properties in your area through local housing authorities
howToApply.step2: Contact property managers to check availability and get on waiting lists
howToApply.step3: Complete application and provide required documentation
howToApply.step4: Participate in interview and background check process
howToApply.step5: Sign lease and move into your affordable housing unit

resources.title: Additional resources:
resources.housingAuthority: Contact your local housing authority for LIHTC property listings

additionalInfo.title: Additional Information Needed
additionalInfo.message: You may qualify for some programs, but we need more information to determine eligibility. Review the program details below and contact the program office for assistance.

processing.title: Processing Your Results
processing.description: We're analyzing your eligibility for government benefit programs. This will only take a moment...

noResults.title: No Results Available
noResults.description: Complete the eligibility questionnaire to see which government benefit programs you may qualify for.

privacy.title: Privacy & Security
privacy.description: Your privacy is our priority. All data processing happens locally on your device.
privacy.encryption: Your data is protected with strong encryption to keep your information secure.
privacy.localStorage: Works completely offline - no internet required for your assessment.

errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.
errors.network: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.validation: Please check your input and try again.
errors.notFound: The requested resource was not found.
errors.unauthorized: You are not authorized to access this resource.
errors.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.
errors.timeout: Request timed out. Please try again.
errors.offline: You are currently offline. Some features may not be available.

descriptions.medicaid: Health coverage for low-income individuals and families
descriptions.snap: SNAP helps low-income individuals and families buy food
descriptions.wic: Provides nutrition assistance to pregnant women, new mothers, and young children
descriptions.tanf: Temporary financial assistance for low-income families with children
descriptions.ssi: Monthly cash assistance for disabled, blind, or elderly with limited income
descriptions.section8: Rental assistance for low-income families and individuals
descriptions.lihtc: Affordable housing options for low-income families

lihtc.title: LIHTC Housing Assessment
lihtc.subtitle: Low-Income Housing Tax Credit Eligibility
lihtc.description: LIHTC provides affordable rental housing for low-income families and individuals through tax credits to developers.

studentStatus.title: Student Status
studentStatus.question: Are you or any household members full-time students?
studentStatus.subtitle: This affects LIHTC eligibility - full-time students are generally ineligible unless exceptions apply
studentStatus.helpText: Single parents and married students may still be eligible even if they are students

warnings.fullTimeStudent: Full-time students may be ineligible for LIHTC housing

unitSize.title: Unit Size Preference
unitSize.question: What size unit are you looking for?
unitSize.subtitle: Choose the unit size that best fits your household needs
unitSize.helpText: LIHTC units are available in various sizes. Your household size will help determine the appropriate unit size.

housingHistory.title: Housing History
housingHistory.question: Have you or any household members lived in subsidized housing before?
housingHistory.subtitle: This includes public housing, Section 8, LIHTC, or other subsidized housing
housingHistory.helpText: Previous subsidized housing experience may affect eligibility for certain programs

options.yes: Yes, I have lived in subsidized housing
options.no: No, I have not lived in subsidized housing

incomeSources.title: Income Sources
incomeSources.question: What are your main sources of household income?
incomeSources.subtitle: Select all that apply to help determine LIHTC eligibility
incomeSources.helpText: Different income sources may be treated differently for LIHTC calculations

rentAffordability.title: Rent Affordability
rentAffordability.question: What is the maximum monthly rent you can afford?
rentAffordability.subtitle: LIHTC units typically have rent caps at 30% of the applicable income limit
rentAffordability.helpText: This helps determine if LIHTC housing is financially appropriate for your household

housingPreferences.title: Housing Preferences
housingPreferences.question: Do you have any specific housing preferences or needs?
housingPreferences.subtitle: Select any that apply to help match you with appropriate LIHTC properties
housingPreferences.helpText: These preferences help identify suitable LIHTC properties in your area

contactPreferences.title: Contact Preferences
contactPreferences.question: How would you like to be contacted about LIHTC housing opportunities?
contactPreferences.subtitle: Select your preferred method for receiving housing information
contactPreferences.helpText: This helps housing authorities contact you about available LIHTC units

nextSteps.contactHousing: Contact local housing authorities for available LIHTC properties
nextSteps.prepareDocuments: Prepare income verification documents (pay stubs, tax returns, bank statements)
nextSteps.checkWaitingLists: Check for waiting lists in your area
nextSteps.considerAlternatives: Consider other affordable housing programs if LIHTC is not available

results.requiredDocuments: You will need to provide the following documents:

documents.incomeVerification: Income verification (pay stubs, tax returns, bank statements)
documents.identification: Government-issued photo ID (driver's license, passport, state ID)
documents.citizenship: Proof of citizenship or eligible immigration status
documents.householdComposition: Proof of household composition (birth certificates, marriage certificates)

descriptions.section8: Provides rental assistance for low-income families
descriptions.disabilityHousing: Accessible affordable housing for people with disabilities

errors.amiDataNotFound: AMI data not found for your location
errors.studentIneligible: Full-time students are generally ineligible for LIHTC housing
errors.unitSizeMismatch: Household size does not match available unit sizes

welcome.title: Welcome to BenefitFinder!
welcome.content: Let's take a quick tour to help you get started. This tool helps you discover government benefits you may be eligible for, all while keeping your information private and secure.

privacy.title: Your Privacy is Protected
privacy.content: All your information stays on your device. We don't collect, store, or share your personal data with anyone. Your privacy is our top priority.

offline.title: Works Offline
offline.content: BenefitFinder works completely offline. No internet connection needed after the initial load. Your data never leaves your device.

encryption.title: Encrypted Storage
encryption.content: Your information is encrypted using military-grade AES-256 encryption. Even if someone accesses your device, your data remains secure.

startButton.title: Ready to Start?
startButton.content: Click the 'Start Assessment' button to begin the questionnaire. It takes about 5-10 minutes to complete and will help us determine which benefits you may qualify for.

overview.title: Your Privacy is Protected
overview.description: BenefitFinder is designed with privacy-first principles. Your personal information never leaves your device and is encrypted at all times.
overview.localProcessingDesc: All eligibility calculations happen on your device
overview.noTrackingDesc: We don't track your browsing or collect analytics
overview.encryptedStorageDesc: Your data is encrypted with AES-256-GCM
overview.offlineFirstDesc: Works completely offline after initial load

data.title: What Data We Handle
data.description: We only process the information you provide to determine your benefit eligibility. No personal identifiers are collected or stored.
data.householdInfo: Household size, income, and basic demographics
data.personalIdentifiers: Names, addresses, SSNs, or other personal identifiers
data.browsingHistory: Your browsing history or other websites you visit
data.analytics: Usage analytics, tracking pixels, or behavioral data

security.title: How We Protect Your Data
security.description: Multiple layers of security protect your information from unauthorized access.
security.encryptionDesc: Your data is encrypted using AES-256-GCM, the same encryption standard used by banks and government agencies.
security.localStorageDesc: All data is stored locally on your device using IndexedDB with RxDB for secure, encrypted storage.
security.noServersDesc: No data is sent to external servers. Everything happens on your device.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.description: You have complete control over your data and can access, export, or delete it at any time.
rights.deleteDataDesc: You can delete all your stored data at any time. This action cannot be undone.
rights.exportDataDesc: Export your eligibility results and data for your own records.
rights.viewDataDesc: All your data is stored locally and accessible through the app interface.

quickstart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickstart.subtitle: Get started in just a few minutes

welcome.title: Welcome to BenefitFinder!
welcome.content: This tool helps you discover government benefits you may be eligible for. We'll guide you through a simple questionnaire to find the best benefits for your situation.

privacy.title: Your Privacy is Protected
privacy.content: All your information stays on your device. We don't collect, store, or share your personal data. Your privacy is our top priority.

questionnaire.title: The Questionnaire
questionnaire.content: We'll ask you about your household size, income, and other factors that determine benefit eligibility. This takes about 5-10 minutes.

results.title: Your Results
results.content: You'll get personalized results showing which benefits you qualify for, required documents, and next steps to apply.

nextSteps.title: Ready to Start?
nextSteps.content: You're all set! The assessment is quick, private, and will help you discover benefits you may not know you're eligible for.

welcome.personalizedResults: Detailed results for each benefit program
welcome.nextSteps: Clear next steps and required documents

results.eligibilityStatus: Clear eligibility status for each program

nextSteps.description: The assessment is designed to be quick and easy. You can save your progress and return later if needed.
